content:
Non esistono eccezioni da autorizzare per i messaggi ricevuti. Probabilmente hai il certificato di sicurezza di uno dei server a cui ti colleghi scaduto o non più valido. Oppure il tuo antivirus ha bloccato di sua iniziativa un certificato.

Quali provider sono configurati in Thunderbird? La tua situazione è simile a questa? -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=67978.0
creator: @next

content:
La procedura per trasferire Thunderbird da un PC all'altro è questa -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/trasferire-dati-thunderbird-nuovo-computer

Se hai seguito questa procedura alla lettera, e non riesci a far funzionare gli account, riporta esattamente i messaggi di errore che ricevi.

content: One option is to not keep the password in Thunderbird, and to enter each time. The other option is to use a Primary Password on Thunderbird so that others cannot start Thunderbird on your PC. Otherwise, I am not aware of a feature to provide a further password for an account.

content: You can create a filter that selects all email to another email account. Or, you can write the filter so that only messages meeting certain criteria are forwarded. click tools>message filters and experiment a bit. FIlters are rather simple, despite the many options displayed,

Microsoft ha cambiato metodo di autenticazione ed ora richiede l'uso di Ouath2 -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/autenticazione-oauth-microsoft-thunderbird-2023

In particolare per la posta in uscita diversi utenti hanno risolto sostituendo il server SMTP smtp-mail.outlook.com con outlook.office365.com

content:
A possible cause of the problem you're seeing is that Thunderbird 128 is shipping with a broken backend, causing IMAP folder corruption under some circumstances.

Currently the only remedy is repairing the affected IMAP folder (Right-click, Properties, Repair Folder), which usually fixes the issue.

Work is underway to understand the problem, but at this time no fix is available yet. For more details see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1890230
creator: christ1

content: I presume you have not upgraded for some time, since threading has been default since summer of 2022. For the background color, I will infer you are using the dark theme. Here is a link on fixing that: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1439822

content: If Carbonite saved your messages, they can be recovered. It may take a few steps, but nothing complex. If you have the files on your PC in IMAP, do NOT attempt to log onto the account. Instead, exit TB and use windows file explorer to locate your files at Imapmail\accountname and copy elsewhere for later restore. If using default setup, copy the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to anywhere for safety. That may be your only backup, so placing also on a USB would be advisable. Once you feel the emergency is past, let us know what you have and we can assist. For now, the safety of you and your family is paramount. Take care.
creator: davidsk

content: You shouldn't be seeing that kind of password prompt if the authentication is OAuth2. See if you have other smtp servers for the account with 'normal password' authentication, and remove any smtp:// or imap:// entries from Saved Passwords in Settings, restart TB, enter the account password in the OAuth dialog.

content:
I have an update and a solution that worked. I am not sure why it worked but here is what I did to solve the problem:

1. Install a 2nd instance of my account under POP3

That was it. Suddenly, I was able to send emails, including from the IMAP account.
